intro: Argyrolobium andrewsianum, commonly known as the silver globular pea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its globular, silver-gray seed pods. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a notable species in its native region.
